questions.text: I often try new things just for fun or thrills, even if most people think it is a waste of time.
I usually am confident that everything will go well even in situations that worry most people.
I often feel that I am the victim of circumstances.
I can usually accept other people as they are, even when they are very different from me.
I like a challenge better than easy jobs.
Often I feel that my life has little purpose or meaning.
I like to help find a solution to problems so that everyone comes out ahead.
I am usually eager to get going on any job I have to do.
I often feel tense and worried in unfamiliar situations, even when others feel there is little to worry about.
I often do things based on how I feel at the moment without thinking about how they were done in the past.
I usually do things my own way, rather than giving in to the wishes of other people.
I often feel a strong sense of unity with all the things around me.
I would do almost anything legal in order to become rich and famous, even if I would lose the trust of many old friends.
I am much more reserved and controlled than most people.
I like to discuss my experiences and feelings openly with friends instead of keeping them to myself.
I have less energy and get tired more quickly than most people.
I seldom feel free to choose what I want to do.
I don’t seem to understand most people very well.
I often avoid meeting strangers because I lack confidence with people I do not know.
I like to please other people as much as I can.
I often wish that I was smarter than everyone else.
No job is too hard for me to do my best.
I often wait for someone else to provide a solution to my problems.
I often spend money until I run out of cash or get into debt from using too much credit.
Often I have unexpected flashes of insight or understanding while relaxing.
I don’t care very much whether other people like me or the way I do things.
I usually try to get just what I want for myself because it is not possible to satisfy everyone anyway.
I have no patience with people who don’t accept my views.
I sometimes feel so connected to nature that everything seems to be part of one living process.
When I have to meet a group of strangers, I am more shy than most people.
I am more sentimental than most people.
I think that most things that are called miracles are just chance.
When someone hurts me in any way, I usually try to get even.
My actions are determined largely by influences outside my control.
Each day I try to take another step toward my goals.
Please select the number four, this is a validity item.
I am a very ambitious person.
I usually stay calm and secure in situations that most people would find physically dangerous.
I do not think it is smart to help weak people who cannot help themselves.
I cannot have any peace of mind if I treat other people unfairly, even if they are unfair to me.
People will usually tell me how they feel.
Sometimes I have felt like I was part of something with no limits or boundaries in time and space.
I sometimes feel a spiritual connection to other people that I cannot explain in words.
I like it when people can do whatever they want without strict rules and regulations.
When I fail at something, I become even more determined to do a better job.
Usually I am more worried than most people that something might go wrong in the future.
I usually think about all the facts in detail before I make a decision.
I have many bad habits that I wish I could break.
Other people control me too much.
I like to be of service to others.
I am usually able to get other people to believe me, even when I know that what I am saying is exaggerated or untrue.
Sometimes I have felt my life was being directed by a spiritual force greater than any human being.
I have a reputation as someone who is very practical and does not act on emotions.
I am strongly moved by sentimental appeals (like when asked to help crippled children).
I am usually so determined that I continue to work long after other people have given up.
I have had moments of great joy in which I suddenly had a clear, deep feeling of oneness with all that exists.
I know what I want to do in my life.
I often cannot deal with problems because I just don’t know what to do.
I prefer spending money rather than saving it.
I have often been called an “eager beaver” because of my enthusiasm for hard work.
If I am embarrassed or humiliated, I get over it very quickly.
I like to strive for bigger and better things.
I usually demand very good practical reasons before I am willing to change my old ways of doing things.
I nearly always stay relaxed and carefree, even when nearly everyone else is fearful.
I find sad songs and movies pretty boring.
Circumstances often force me to do things against my will.
I usually enjoy being mean to anyone who has been mean to me.
I often become so fascinated with what I’m doing that I get lost in the moment – like I’m detached from time and place.
I do not think I have a real sense of purpose for my life.
I often feel tense and worried in unfamiliar situations, even when others feel there is no danger at all.
I often follow my instincts, hunches, or intuition without thinking through all the details.
I love to excel at everything I do.
I often feel a strong spiritual or emotional connection with all the people around me.
I usually try to imagine myself “in other people’s shoes”, so I can really understand them.
Principles like fairness and honesty have little role in some aspects of my life.
I am more hard-working than most people.
Even when most people feel it is not important, I often insist on things being done in a strict and orderly way.
I feel very confident and sure of myself in almost all social situations.
My friends find it hard to know my feelings because I seldom tell them about my private thoughts.
I am good at communicating my feelings to others.
I am more energetic and tire less quickly than most people.
I often stop what I am doing because I get worried, even when my friends tell me everything will go well.
I often wish I was more powerful than everyone else.
Members of a team rarely get their fair share.
I don’t go out of my way to please other people.
I am not shy with strangers at all.
I spend most of my time doing things that seem necessary but not really important to me.
I don’t think that religious or ethical principles about what is right and wrong should have much influence in business decisions.
I often try to put aside my own judgments so that I can better understand what other people are experiencing.
Many of my habits make it hard for me to accomplish worthwhile goals.
I have made real personal sacrifices in order to make the world a better place – like trying to prevent war, poverty and injustice.
It takes me a long time to warm up to other people.
It gives me pleasure to see my enemies suffer.
No matter how hard a job is, I like to get started quickly.
It often seems to other people like I am in another world because I am so completely unaware of things going on around me.
I usually like to stay cool and detached from other people.
I am more likely to cry at a sad movie than most people.
I recover more quickly than most people from minor illnesses or stress.
I often feel like I am a part of the spiritual force on which all life depends.
I need much more practice in developing good habits before I will be able to trust myself in many tempting situations.
Please select the number one; this is a validity item.
I like to make quick decisions so I can get on with what has to be done.
I am usually confident that I can easily do things that most people would consider dangerous (such as driving an automobile fast on a wet or icy road)
I like to explore new ways to do things.
I enjoy saving money more than spending it on entertainment or thrills.
I have had personal experiences in which I felt in contact with a divine and wonderful spiritual power.
I have so many faults that I don’t like myself very much.
Most people seem more resourceful than I am.
I often break rules and regulations when I think I can get away with it.
Even when I am with friends, I prefer not to “open up” very much.
The harder a job is the more I like it.
Often when I look at an ordinary thing, something wonderful happens – I get the feeling that I am seeing it fresh for the first time.
I usually feel tense and worried when I have to do something new and unfamiliar.
I am eager to start work on any assigned duty.
My will power is too weak to overcome very strong temptations, even if I know I will suffer as a consequence.
If I am feeling upset, I usually feel better around friends than when left alone.
I often accomplish more than people expect of me.
Religious experiences have helped me to understand the real purpose of my life.
I usually push myself harder than most people do because I want to do as well as I possibly can.
Please select five, this is a validity item.
I usually feel much more confident and energetic than most people, even after minor illnesses or stress.
When nothing new is happening, I usually start looking for something that is thrilling or exciting.
I like to think about things for a long time before I make a decision.
People involved with me have to learn how to do things my way.
I make a warm personal connection with most people.
I am often described as an overachiever.
I would rather read a book than talk about my feelings with another person.
I enjoy getting revenge on people who hurt me.
If something doesn’t work as I expected, I am more likely to quit than to keep going for a long time.
It is easy for other people to get close to me emotionally.
I would probably stay relaxed and outgoing when meeting a group of strangers, even if I were told they are unfriendly.
Please select the number two; this is a validity item
I generally don’t like people who have different ideas from me.
I often drag my heels a while before starting any project.
I can usually do a good job of stretching the truth to tell a funnier story or to play a joke on someone.
It is extremely difficult for me to adjust to changes in my usual way of doing things because I get so tense, tired, or worried.
I am more of a perfectionist than most people.
Other people often think that I am too independent because I won’t do what they want.
I am better at saving money than most people.
I often give up a job if it takes much longer than I thought it would.
Whether something is right or wrong is just a matter of opinion.
I often learn a lot from people.
I believe that all life depends on some spiritual order or power that cannot be completely explained.
Things often go wrong for me unless I am very careful.
I am slower than most people to get excited about new ideas and activities.
I could probably accomplish more than I do, but I don’t see the point in pushing myself harder than is necessary to get by.
I usually stay away from social situations where I would have to meet strangers, even if I am assured that they will be friendly.
I often feel so connected to the people around me that it is like there is no separation between us.
In most situations my natural responses are based on good habits that I have developed.
I often have to stop what I am doing because I start worrying about what might go wrong.
I am often called “absent-minded” because I get so wrapped up in what I am doing that I lose track of everything else.
I often consider another person’s feelings as much as my own.
I am often described as an underachiever.
Most of the time I would prefer to do something a little risky (like riding in a fast automobile over steep hills and sharp turns) rather than having to stay quiet and inactive for a few hours.
Some people think I am too stingy or tight with my money.
I like old “tried and true” ways of doing things much better than trying “new and improved” ways.
I often do things to help protect animals and plants from extinction.
I often push myself to the point of exhaustion or try to do more than I really can.
I am not very good at talking my way out of trouble when I am caught doing something wrong.
Repeated practice has given me good habits that are stronger than most momentary impulses or persuasion.
I think I will have very good luck in the future.
I open up quickly to other people, even if I don’t know them well.
When I fail to master something at first, it becomes my personal challenge to succeed.
You don’t have to be dishonest to succeed in business.
In conversations I am much better as a listener than as a talker.
I would not be happy in a job where I did not communicate with other people.
My attitudes are determined largely by influences outside my control.
I often wish I was stronger than everyone else.
I often need naps or extra rest periods because I get tired so easily.
I have trouble telling a lie, even when it is meant to spare someone else’s feelings.
Regardless of any temporary problem that I have to overcome, I always think it will turn out well.
It is hard for me to enjoy spending money on myself, even when I have saved plenty of money.
I often do my best work under difficult circumstances.
I like to keep my problems to myself.
I have a vivid imagination.
I like to stay at home better than to travel or explore new places.
Warm friendships with other people are very important to me.
I often wish I could stay young forever.
I like to read everything when I am asked to sign any papers.
I think I would stay confident and relaxed when meeting strangers, even if I were told they are angry at me.
I feel it is more important to be sympathetic and understanding of other people than to be practical and tough-minded.
I often wish I had special powers like Superman.
I like to share what I have learned with other people.
I usually look at a difficult situation as a challenge or opportunity.
Most people I know look out only for themselves, no matter who else gets hurt.
I need much extra rest, support, or reassurance to recover from minor illnesses or stress.
I know there are principles for living that no one can violate without suffering in the long run.
I don’t want to be richer than everyone else.
I like to go slow in starting work, even if it is easy to do.
I would gladly risk my own life to make the world a better place.
When my work goes unnoticed, I become even more determined to succeed.
I often wish I could stop the passage of time.
I hate to make decisions based only on my first impressions.
I would rather be alone than deal with other people’s problems.
I don’t want to be more admired than everyone else.
I need a lot of help from other people to train me to have good habits.
I like to do a job quickly and then volunteer for more.
It is hard for me to tolerate people who are different from me.
I would rather be kind than get revenge when someone hurts me.
I really enjoy keeping busy.
I try to cooperate with others as much as possible.
I am often successful because of my ambition and hard work.
It is usually easy for me to like those people who have different values from me.
Good habits have become “second nature” to me – they are automatic and spontaneous actions nearly all the time.
I hate to change the way I do things, even if many people tell me there is a new and better way to do it.
I think it is unwise to believe in things that cannot be explained scientifically.
I am willing to make many sacrifices to be a success.
I like to imagine my enemies suffering.
Select three, this is a validity item.
I like to pay close attention to details in everything I do.
I usually am free to choose what I will do.
Often I become so involved in what I am doing that I forget where I am for a while.
I like other people to know that I really care about them.
Most of the time I would prefer to do something risky (like hang-gliding or parachute jumping), rather than having to stay quiet and inactive for a few hours.
Because I so often spend too much money on impulse, it is hard for me to save money, even for special plans like a vacation.
I often give in to the wishes of friends.
I never worry about terrible things that might happen in the future.
People find it easy to come to me for help, sympathy, and warm understanding.
Most of the time I quickly forgive anyone who does me wrong.
I think my natural responses now are usually consistent with my principles and long-term goals.
I prefer to wait for someone else to take the lead in getting things done.
It is fun for me to buy things for myself.
I have had experiences that made my role in life so clear to me that I felt very excited and happy.
I usually respect the opinions of others.
My behavior is strongly guided by certain goals that I have set for my life.
It is usually foolish to promote the success of other people.
I often wish I could live forever.
When someone points out my mistakes, I work extra hard to correct them.
I won’t give up what I am doing just because of a long run of unexpected failures.
I usually have good luck in whatever I try to do.
I wish I were better looking than everyone else.
Reports of mystical experiences are probably just wishful thinking.
Individual rights are more important than the needs of any group.
Dishonesty only causes problems if you get caught.
Good habits make it easier for me to do things the way I want.
Other people and conditions are often to blame for my problems.
I usually can stay “on the go” all day without having to push myself.
I want to be the best at everything I do.
I nearly always think about all the facts in detail before I make a decision, even when other people demand a quick decision.
I am quick to volunteer when there is something to be do.
